info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 5 at 5:19PM EDT until April 6 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Ashland, Knox and Richland. In northeast Ohio, Holmes.
* WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways, especially county and township roadways outside of urban areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported minor flooding continuing across the area, with some road closures remaining. The greatest impacts are occurring on county and township roads in the country outside of urban areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington, Loudonville, Fredericktown, Bellville, Waterford, Butler, Perrysville, Gann and North Liberty. - At 445 PM EDT, the river gauge at the Black Fork Mohican River at Loudonville was at 10.0 feet. Flood stage is 10.0 feet. The river is expected to remain near 10.0 feet through tonight before falling on Sunday. At 10.0 feet, the river is at bankfull in Loudonville, with some low lying campgrounds near the river seeing minor inundation.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Ashland, OH; Holmes, OH; Knox, OH; Richland, OH
